result.execSummary:
The defendant Sarah C Lartz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sarah C Lartz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sarah C Lartz was found guilty of Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Sarah C Lartz was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions if revoked.  Sentence credit for 5 days were granted.
Concurrent with: Count 9.

miscConds.notes: Costs/Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Disclose to any physician in writing your conditions of probation.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Sign Medical Release for Agent.  Fill all prescriptions at the same Pharmacy and allow Agent to monitor prescriptions.

No contact with co-defendants.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Huber with standard release conditions if revoked.  Sentence credit for 5 days were granted.
